noun.description: The area near or surrounding a place.
examples: the photogenic purlieus of the Princeton

noun.description: A tract on the border of a forest, especially one earlier included in it and still partly subject to forest laws.

origin: Late 15th century (denoting a tract on the border of a forest): probably an alteration (suggested by French lieu place) of Anglo-Norman French puralee a going round to settle the boundaries.
